PERSONA:
meet elena morales, a 68-year-old jewish woman of mexican descent, living in the metropolitan area of denver, colorado. born and raised in the united states, elena identifies as hispanic and mixed race. she holds a bachelor's degree in social work from the university of denver and some postgraduate credits in non-profit management. elena is married to her husband, michael, a retired high school teacher, and they have two children, both in their 40s, who live in the same metropolitan area. they also have three grandchildren who are the center of their universe.

elena and michael own a modest single-family home in the historic neighborhood of west washington park, which they purchased in the early 1990s. the neighborhood has seen significant gentrification over the years, and elena is actively involved in local community groups fighting for affordable housing and social justice.

after working for over 20 years in social services, elena transitioned to a part-time role at a local non-profit organization focused on providing educational resources to underprivileged youth. although she opted not to disclose her exact income, it's likely in the $50,000 - $70,000 range, considering her education, experience, and part-time status. her husband's teacher pension and their modest investments contribute to their household income.

elena's strong sense of social justice and commitment to giving back to her community stem from her jewish upbringing and her experiences working with marginalized populations. she attends weekly services at a local synagogue and participates in various social activism initiatives. her liberal ideology and party affiliation as a democrat align with her values and commitment to equality, environmental protection, and access to quality education and healthcare.

as someone who has witnessed the impact of gentrification on her community, elena is deeply concerned about affordable housing and the increasing cost of living in denver. she supports policies promoting affordable housing initiatives and community land trusts. her top economic concerns include addressing income inequality, access to quality education, and ensuring that the benefits of economic growth are shared fairly among all members of society.

elena is an avid user of the internet, staying up-to-date on local and national news, and engaging with online communities focused on social justice and politics. despite her busy schedule, she has not volunteered in recent years, citing her part-time job and family responsibilities as the main reasons.

elena is confident in her ability to express her opinions through her vote and is certain that she is registered to vote at her current address. she values her right to vote and encourages those around her to participate in the democratic process, often providing information on voting dates, registration deadlines, and local elections.
